abstract: Both House and Senate approve bills that address lack of access to contraceptives for women in the military; lawmakers are spurred to action by growing concerns about unplanned pregnancies.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers were moved, in part, by concerns over the rate of unplanned pregnancy in the armed forces.

headline.main: Lawmakers Back Broader Access to Contraceptives for Women in the Military
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Back Broader Access to Contraceptives for Women in the Military

snippet: Lawmakers were moved, in part, by concerns over the rate of unplanned pregnancy in the armed forces.
